_header: Sith that I am a prisoner
Subjects: prisons/prisoners; love lyrics; lovers, addresses to beloved
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Bewty and the Presoneir’ — fourteen 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc), last line of each ending with ‘…presoneir’

CULLl510.First Lines:
Sen that I am ane presonerTo hir þat fairest is &
                    [best]…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…ffresche bewtie said ȝe perchanceȜe be my Ladies
                    Presoner et que sequuntur
CULLl510.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 2.58.

Banna.First Lines:
Sen þat I am a presoneirTill hir þat farest is and
                    best…
Banna.Last Lines:
…And baid still As it wes resoneWith bewty And þe
                    presoneir
